resources.string: Qtunr is an open source XMPP messenger for Android, iOS and Web platforms. It is build around open standards, interoperability, design and great user experience. Versions of Qtunr for every platform are built to provide a continuous chat experience between them.

Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP) is a communications protocol for message-oriented middleware based on XML (Extensible Markup Language). It enables the near-real-time exchange of structured yet extensible data between any two or more network entities. The protocol was originally named Jabber, and was developed by the Jabber open-source community in 1999 for near real-time instant messaging (IM),presence information, and contact list maintenance.
XMPP is highly extensible, via extensions known as XEPs (XMPP Extension Protocol). Qtunr supports a number of popular XEPs that are essential to providing great chat experience for our users.

Qtunr for Android was originally developed by Redsolution â€” an international software and services company currently based in Estonia. Since then, a number of individuals joined Qtunr as developers, testers and translators.

Our goal is to create a stable, reliable, interoperable and user friendly ecosystem for instant messaging that does not rely on proprietary services and data silos. We welcome anyone who believes in open standards and free information interchange to take part in moving Qtunr forward.

Follow us on Twitter and Github.

Qtunr is available in multiple languages thanks to many fine people from all over the world. We have created a special page on our website to acknowledge their efforts.\n\nYou may join their ranks and help us improve translation quality by contributing your translations to Qtunr project.

Qtunr source code is licensed under GNU GPL v.3 license and is available on GitHub.

Graphical images are licensed under Creative Commons Attribution Share-Alike (CC BY-SA) license.

Qtunr & Redsolution logo are property of Redsolution, Inc.

More detailed information on Qtunr license file.
Unfortunately, Qtunr does not have a translation to your language, but you can help us fix that.\nQtunr is open-source, and all translations are provided by community, and it is easy to join.
